topics.title: Invention takes little time, long execution
topics.summary: Ethan frames invention as needing only occasional focused time, while the real work is years of execution and iteration (Prime, Kindle). He argues a few good ideas can make you seem highly inventive.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Ethan Evans’ Amazon background, leadership experience, patents, and current coaching work, plus a preview of key topics (Magic Loop, Bezos failure story, interviews, leadership principles).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Sidebar (peer leadership groups) and Sprig (AI-powered product research/insights platform).

topics.title: The Magic Loop overview and five steps
topics.summary: Ethan explains why the Magic Loop resonated and walks through the five steps: do your job well, ask how to help, do what’s asked, align help with your goals, and repeat. They discuss why it’s “magic” and how it works even with busy/mediocre managers.

topics.title: Magic Loop proof, levels, and advanced mode
topics.summary: Ethan shares outcomes from entry-level to executive growth, and explains how the loop evolves at senior levels into proactive problem-finding and execution. They emphasize trust-building, clarifying goals, and using the loop even when not seeking promotion.

topics.title: Getting unstuck at senior manager to director
topics.summary: They discuss why L7/M2 leaders stall (org bottlenecks, lean economy) and what changes are required to move up: influence, strategic thinking, and letting go of details. Ethan advises practicing next-level skills and positioning yourself as the obvious pick when opportunities arise.

topics.title: Systematic inventiveness and idea generation practice
topics.summary: Ethan connects Amazon’s culture to being an “invention machine,” explains how he learned to invent systematically (expertise + dedicated thinking time), and shares a drone-delivery ‘aircraft carrier truck’ patent example. He argues you only need occasional focused sessions to generate ideas, then years to execute.

topics.title: Interviewing: enthusiasm, presence, and impact
topics.summary: Ethan shares what stands out in interviews: professional presence, visible enthusiasm (especially on Zoom), and communicating business impact—not just tasks. He recommends being fully present on camera and prioritizing energy and clarity over over-optimizing content.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Arcade, a no-code interactive demo platform, including a customer conversion/engagement case study and discount offer.

topics.title: Failure corner: Appstore launch breaks for Bezos
topics.summary: Ethan recounts a high-stakes Amazon Appstore launch where a key ‘Test Drive’ feature failed, triggering escalating scrutiny from Jeff Bezos and senior leaders. He describes responding by owning the failure, providing hourly updates, and getting emergency help from AWS engineers to stabilize the system.

topics.title: Rebuilding trust: facing Bezos after the incident
topics.summary: After the launch, Bezos continues testing and reporting issues; Ethan chooses to attend a meeting rather than avoid him. Bezos acknowledges the hard week and they have a human conversation, signaling forgiveness but the need to re-earn trust.
